intro: Cyperus leucaspis, commonly known as the silver spike sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and cylindrical, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, including marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist to saturated soil conditions. Its silver-gray sheathing leaves and pale spikelets make it visually distinctive. Cyperus leucaspis is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various aquatic environments.
